Primary End Point
The median times to the first recurrence of atrial fibrillation are shown in Table 2 according to the intention to treat and to the treatment actually received. Amiodarone and sotalol were both significantly more effective than placebo in increasing the time to a recurrence of atrial fibrillation (P<0.001). Amiodarone was six times as effective as sotalol in the intention-to-treat analysis (P<0.001) and four times as effective in the analysis according to the treatment actually received (P<0.001).
